name: NewYorker
text: When the coronavirus took hold in New York City, there was "just a feeling of desolation," a local bus operator said, "almost apocalyptic in nature." He reflects on the pandemic's early days in a new episode of #NewYorkerRadio. Listen here. https://t.co/d63DwM49yT

name: NewYorker
text: The activist and sociologist George Lakey has trained activists in countries including South Africa, Thailand, and Sri Lanka in their struggles against repressive regimes. Now he is turning his attention to the U.S. https://t.co/fylHEWQPOy
